content:
Hi all,
my name is FireFighterDuck and I'm kinda new here.
I started learning Rust about three years ago and am currently participating in an university course about open source projects, for which I did some research about the Rust language community in general and the Chalk project in particular. Chalk's approach of lowering trait dependencies into logic programs fascinates me and I hope to be able to contribute something to the project in the long run. Other than Rust, I'm also interested in both programming language design/compiler construction and program verification/automatic proving; both topics that overlap in Chalk.
I'm looking forward to learn a lot around here and hopefully I'll be able to help out a bit in the process as well.
Hello! You might have found it already; if not, chalk is this way.
@FireFighterDuck Hi! Definitely feel free to stop by :) We have weekly meetings Tuesdays at 4 PM EST that you might be interested in joining. Otherwise, Chalk repo is here :)
